column4: Just extracted a large archive with the default manager and noticed that the cpu usage was constantly 25%, so i checked it out and it seems that its using 100% of one core at a time of my quad-core. Can i make the archiver use all 4 cores?
: why do you want to do that?
well im running a 10,000rpm raptor, so its not really maxing it out
: some programs have that in their options
: try a google
j2daosh Found the solution. MT-write can be used in place of File Roller (which is default) and supports multiple threads.. archives scream now!
whats up?
no sound? no video?
laptop/desktop?
what camera (make and model) and waht drivers? Does it work in other programs such as Cheese?
quick cam chat.i think i dont have a video driver.
is that a logitech?
yes
yeah i have something similar that iv yet to set up still...  also logitech quickcam something
what do you mean?
i have one too, and it isnt working either. but i havent tried very hard to set it up yet
you know what to do?
in ubuntu 8.04 worked
in theory yes. we just need to find some drivers that work for it. but lgitech doesnt make any, and i havent looked for others yet as i dont really use video much
have you googled for some drivers?
what are you running now then?
